result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John W Reynolds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John W Reynolds in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 13CF69, 13CM73, 14CF31

14CF31: 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:  14CF31 is dismissed and read-in. 

13CF69 and 13CM73:
Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  
Atty Renc states corrections to the PSI. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 
No victims are present. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court.  Asks to leave the restitution amount open for 60 days.  
Court questions defendant.

BY THE COURT: 
13CF69 Counts 1 and 6 - Sentence withheld.  Placed on probation for a period of 30 months:
Counts 9 and 12 - Sentence withheld.  Placed on Probation for a period of 18 months, concurrent with Counts 1 & 6:
Pay costs on all 4 counts. To be paid within the next 60 days or set up a payment plan.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and drugs. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
If prescribed medication, obtain from only one pharmacy and disclose that pharmacy to the agent and sign releases that the agent requires to monitor compliance. 
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment. 
Participate in any employment development courses or programs that the agent recommends. 
Pay restitution to BP Plover for $157.91 and $90.69 to Family Video.  Defense is allowed 30 days to contest those amounts.  Court grants State 45 days to determine restitution.  If not agreed upon, then a hearing will need to be held. 
Provide DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. 
No contact with BP or Cooper Oil. 
Pay minimum of $50 per month towards restitution starting March 2014. 
Will amend the order of fulltime employment to a combination of work or school for fulltime when restitution is paid in full.
Not possess any personal identification, checks or checks belonging to anyone other than himself. 
Perform 30 hours community service during course of term of probation.  Should be done with Portage County Parks Department unless reasonable arrangements can't be made.  
Should be performing community service hours when not employed. 

COUNT 1 - Serve 129 days jail, credit for 129 days served.  Conditions has been met. 

13CM73 - 
Count 1 - Sentence withheld. Placed on probation for a period of 18 months, concurrent:
Pay costs.  To be paid within 60 days. 

Atty Cousins makes statements regarding restitution amounts given may not be correct.  Asks for 30 days to provide correct amounts. 

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the State 45 days to determine restitution.  If not agreed upon, then hearing will be held.
Status conference on February 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
$500 sig bond:  Comply with all conditions of bond currently under.

Defendant John W Reynolds in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
State requests a $500 sig bond:  Comply with all conditions of bond currently under.  Status conference scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
